body.name: Davinci Union 4-in-1 Convertible Crib in White, Greenguard Gold Certified
features: GREENGUARD Gold Certified: This product has been tested for over 10,000 chemicals It contributes to cleaner indoor air, creating a healthier environment for your baby to sleep, play and grow

GROWS WITH BABY: Four adjustable mattress positions that can be lowered as your baby begins to sit and stand Easily converts to toddler bed, daybed and full-size bed (toddler kit M3899 and full-size kit M4799 sold separately)
QUALITY MATERIAL: Made of solid sustainable New Zealand pine wood Finished in a non-toxic multi-step painting process and lead and phthalate safe
FOR YOUR BABY'S SAFETY: Say goodbye to toxic chemicals Finished in a non-toxic multi-step painting process and lead and phthalate safe
MATTRESS COMPATIBILITY: While this crib is a standard size regular crib, for a best fit we recommend DaVinci’s line of non-toxic, GREENGUARD Gold, waterproof mattresses
body.description: The union 4-in-1 convertible crib is a durable and chic staple for the modern nursery, with fixed side rails, non-toxic lead and phthalate-safe finish, and sturdy construction from sustainable New Zealand pine, the union crib is a safe place for baby to rest easily. The union crib converts to a day bed, toddler bed (with conversion kit, sold separately), and full size bed (with conversion kit, sold separately), and takes a standard size crib mattress (sold separately). JPMA certified for the utmost safety, meets ASTM international and US CPSC safety standards.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Gabby Pillowback Swivel Glider Charlie 6-Drawer Double Dresser Twin/Full Size Bed Conversion Kit Toddler Bed Conversion Kit Complete Slumber Crib & Toddler Mattress Shown In Misty Grey White Grey Grey -

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Feels Stable, Good Quality
reviews.reviewText: A little backstory: my husband and I had wanted to plan on doing a Montessori floor bed for our son when he was ready to transition to his own room, but realized that, for us, this may not happen for quite some time (and by that point we may just go straight to toddler bed). Our 11 week old son had recently outgrown his smaller bassinet, and in this transition has been sleeping in the bassinet insert in a pack n play in our room- but now that he is more active and wiggling and kicking all the time, the pack n play bassinet just does not feel stable (plus the “mattress” is really just more of a board which I can’t imagine would be comfy for sleeping).Just received the crib yesterday, and my husband set it up last night in our bedroom (our son will sleep in our room until at least 6 months, if not longer). As far as I know, it was relatively easy and straightforward to set up, although the longer front and back pieces weren’t labeled up from down so my husband just had to flip it around at one point to get all the edges along the top flush.Obviously have not had this crib long enough to comment on durability, but it feels extremely stable (which was my main worry when ordering a crib that was under $100). It does not wiggle at all, and all of the joints are completely tight together. I was worried about the hardware not being hidden like some of the more expensive crib models, but the ebony color we ordered came with dark charcoal/black hardware so it barely shows at all. Not sure that would have been the case with the hardware that comes with the other color options.We have the Newton Baby crib mattress (also highly recommend!) and it fits so perfectly in this crib- so snug down in the frame there’s not even a hair of space between the mattress and the slats.I didn’t really check the height of the crib before ordering, so was a little surprised with how low it seems overall- but I actually prefer that, since our son’s nursery is pretty small I think it will feel more size-appropriate for the space once we move it in there.Will update in the future if this changes, but so far, very happy we took the chance on this very affordable, cute little crib!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my son who is 7 months old now.It's a great product, holds up well and does as it's intended. Easy to assemble. Strong quality bolts etc.I think the only thing I was bummed about is it doesn't include the bed guard attachment for when you transition baby to a toddler bed. You have to buy that separately and they are not always in stock.Other cribs I've bought over the years always had that piece included.It's a small inconvenience and not the end of the world. The piece costs about $30 USD if I remember correctly.Something to keep in mind if you are wanting a crib with this attachment piece already.I will say it is a beautiful crib though. I like the color we bought, ours is gray. Fits a typical crib mattress very well without leaving little gaps as some cribs from othet makers can do.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect cheap efficient crib
reviews.reviewText: Love it. Wasn’t terribly hard to put together. It’s lightweight, so it’s easy to move around. It does chip easily but that doesn’t matter to me. You get what you pay for so pick and choose what matters to you. Originally purchased a mini crib and realized I was in need of a standard size crib and this was not only affordable but fits perfectly in my nursery and baby seems to love already. Especially with the graco mattress I ordered to go with it. Would purchase again. Recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good enough for baby
reviews.reviewText: The crib is relatively easy to assemble by following the instructions. I was able to assemble it myself. It is lightweight. All the parts were complete. I agree with some of the other reviews that the crib is slightly splintery. I did get 2 splinters while assembling, but that is the quality you get for the price. It seems pretty sturdy after assembly. I think it looks nice, clean, and simple. 4 different mattress heights to choose from. Again, you get what you pay for.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simple but perfect
reviews.reviewText: Very simple but cute look. I love how easy it was to put together. The size is also good ( not too big or too small).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Baby boy LOVES his new crib!
reviews.reviewText: My husband and I are thrilled about this crib. Our 8month old recently grew out of his bedside bassinet and we searched long and hard for a crib we felt comfortable moving forward with. Took a chance on this one after reading other reviews, and we’re glad we did. It’s sturdy and well-made. And we love the different configurations we can choose from as baby boy grows (I do wish it came with additional instructions for each option beyond the traditional crib). Assembly was relatively simple (though my husband did 99% of the work). We’re also very happy with the color!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simple, easy to assemble, shorter than expected, but decent for the price
reviews.reviewText: Update: 4/28/20 our daughter is going to be 3 in June and still happily sleeps in this crib (and she’s a solid kid, wears a size 3/4T already and over 35 lbs). It’s still as solid as it was the day we first put it together. Great buy! Updating review to 5 starsOriginal: We bought this crib for our 3rd daughter (after giving away the one we used for our other daughters). I wasn't looking for anything super high quality, as I am certain this will be our last child, and for $117 I don't think it's a bad buy by any means. But I'm not sure how well this will hold up to the wear/tear of a toddler when it's converted to a toddler bed knowing how my others daughter used to push on the sides of the cribs/climb all over it, etc. But I do think it'll do it's job as a crib for a small baby.One thing I wasn't quite expecting was how short the crib is. My 5 year old daughter is tall enough to see into the crib w/o having to look through the crib slats. This doesn't bother me though as I'm excited for my girls to be able to stare lovingly at their new baby sister :), but I wonder too how this will work to keep a baby in their crib when they are taller, standing and climbing around. Our previous crib was a DaVinci model that our daughters were never able to (or at least never tried to) climb out of, and they stayed in it as a crib for 2 years, then another year or so as a toddler bed.Bottom line: if you are looking for something smaller (probably same size as an Ikea crib), simple looking and not needing a crib that will last through more than one child this is a good buy.
Easy to put together, large and very nice colour. Seems sturdy

nice, lightweight crib. easy to put together. it's quite low to the ground, even when you put the mattress at the highest level. easy to move from room to room. expensive price in India compared to the US since it is imported. have read comments about it scratching easily so we are being careful.
Hermosa cuna es ligera acabado de buena calidad el color es muy bonito facil de armar, es convertible a cama infantil y con el kit que se compra aparte se vuelve cama matrimonial

reviews.reviewTitle: Great quality and price. Easy, fast assembly. Arrived within a week. Really pleased.
reviews.reviewText: Very good quality. Was assembled in 20 minutes with no issues. Bought a second one. (I operate a daycare). Really impressed with quality for price. Fast delivery also.
Il lettino è fatto veramente bene, ha 4 livelli di altezza rete materasso,i materiali sono buoni.Il materasso corretto è 130 x 70 cm.Facile montaggio
